bill_title: authorize the secretary of agriculture to suspend or revoke an egg dealer's or processor's license for certain violations and to provide the licensee an opportunity for a hearing.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the secretary of agriculture to suspend or revoke an egg dealer's or processor's license for certain violations and to provide the licensee an opportunity for a hearing. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 39-11-17 be amended to read as follows: 39-11-17. It shall be the duty of the The secretary of agriculture at any time to shall revoke or suspend any license issued pursuant to this chapter on evidence that the licensee has violated any or all of the provisions of this chapter or has refused to comply with any and all lawful regulations promulgated as herein provided regulations promulgated thereunder or has refused to permit inspection or interfered with inspection . No license shall may be revoked except on twenty days' notice to the licensee or his agent to be served by registered mail, specifying the substance of the complaint and the time and place in which evidence will be heard in support of the complaint. Opportunity shall be afforded such licensee to submit evidence and proof in denial of such charges or suspended unless the license holder has been given an opportunity for hearing. The secretary shall, upon request of the holder of a permit, fix the time and place of the hearing. Notice and hearing shall be made pursuant to chapter 1-26 .

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the secretary of agriculture to suspend or revoke an egg dealer's or processor's license for certain violations and to provide the licensee an opportunity for a hearing. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 39-11-17 be amended to read as follows: 39-11-17. It shall be the duty of the The secretary of agriculture at any time to shall revoke or suspend any license issued pursuant to this chapter on evidence that the licensee has violated any or all of the provisions of this chapter or has refused to comply with any and all lawful regulations promulgated as herein provided regulations promulgated thereunder or has refused to permit inspection or interfered with inspection . No license shall may be revoked except on twenty days' notice to the licensee or his agent to be served by registered mail, specifying the substance of the complaint and the time and place in which evidence will be heard in support of the complaint. Opportunity shall be afforded such licensee to submit evidence and proof in denial of such charges or suspended unless the license holder has been given notice and an opportunity for hearing pursuant to chapter 1-26 . 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
